summary: This is an email chain from May 26, 2020, regarding a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to create video clips from the deposition videos of Ghislaine Maxwell in connection with the Epstein investigation. The email specifies the Q&A sequences of interest and provides instructions for accessing the video files and sharing the clips.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the deposition videos from which video clips are to be created as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: M (USANYS)
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is coordinating the video clip creation request and is copied on the email.

connections.description: C, from the U.S. Attorney's Office, is requesting video clips from Maxwell's deposition as part of the Epstein investigation.
Both are part of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York working on the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Request for Maxwell Deposition Video Clips
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requests the creation of video clips from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Usa.doj.gov\cloud\NYS StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018R01618 InvestigationVI 2018 SDNY investigation\Subpoena Ret ria202CS, third subpoena response Videos
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively working on the Epstein investigation as of May 2020, specifically focusing on Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition.
Video deposition footage of Ghislaine Maxwell existed and was being analyzed, with specific Q&A sequences identified for clipping.
The email references a shared digital folder containing investigation materials, including videos produced in response to a subpoena.
The document indicates coordination between different personnel within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding evidence preparation.
